git clone: Clones a repository into a new directory.
git status: Displays the state of the working directory and the staging area.
git add: Adds file contents to the index (staging area).
git push: Updates remote refs along with associated objects.
git pull: Fetches from and integrates with another repository or a local branch.
git checkout: Switches branches or restores working tree files.
git merge: Joins two or more development histories together.
npm install: Installs the dependencies defined in the package.json file.
npm start: Runs the defined start script in the package.json file.
npm run build: Runs the defined build script to compile the application.
node: Executes the Node.js REPL or runs a script file.
pwd: Print Working Directory - displays the current directory path.
touch: Changes file timestamps or creates an empty file.
chmod: Changes file modes or access permissions.
sudo: Executes a command as another user, typically the superuser.
ps: Reports a snapshot of the current processes.
kill: Sends a signal to a process (usually to terminate it).
ping: Sends ICMP ECHO_REQUEST to network hosts.
curl: Transfers data from or to a server.
unzip: Extract compressed files in a ZIP archive.
docker build: Builds an image from a Dockerfile.
docker run: Run a command in a new container.
docker stop: Stop one or more running containers.
docker-compose up: Builds, (re)creates, starts, and attaches to containers for a service.
docker-compose down: Stops and removes containers, networks, images, and volumes.
